thread.title: Firefighters battle blaze on Hobart's eastern shore
thread.title_full: Firefighters battle blaze on Hobart's eastern shore

title: Firefighters battle blaze on Hobart's eastern shore
text:
Tasmanian firefighters battling blaze near Hobart; watch and act alert for Lindisfarne Posted February 15, 2017 17:26:47 
A watch and act alert has been issued for a fire burning on Hobart's eastern shore. 
Firefighters and aircraft are trying to bring a vegetation fire at Tianna Road, Lindisfarne, under control. 
Residents in the areas of Tianna Road, Moirunna Road, Raminea Road, Rowitta Road and Derwent Avenue are urged to take action to protect homes and be prepared to leave. 
The fire service's website said embers, smoke and ash may be falling on Lindisfarne and Geilston Bay. 
A total fire ban is in force in southern Tasmania because of hot and windy conditions. 
The temperature in Hobart is 26 degrees Celsius, with winds gusting up to 60 kilometre per hour.
